intro: Bupleurum tenuissimum subsp. eutenuissimum, commonly known as the slender valerian, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies eutenuissimum is distinguished by its more slender leaves and slightly different floral structure compared to the typical form.
